social_posts.post_text: 7 hours in a library with these cuties? Don't mind if I do. Just getting some @inclusiveguide work done with @crystalegli and @katherinetameraegli the tech genius and mind behind @euphorialgbt .

When you're a black femme tech founder, finding others like you can feel like a game of 'Where's Waldo?' Except in this version, you're not just looking for the one red and white striped shirt, you're looking for the one other person of color in the sea of yt tech bros. So thankful for programs like Access Mode that bring underrepresented tech founders together to give resources, money, and support.

🎉 Exciting News! 🎉

We are thrilled to announce that Inclusive Guide @inclusiveguide was chosen as a winner of the prestigious 2023 Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Award from the Denver Business Journal! 🏆✨

This incredible recognition is a testament to our commitment to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable environment within our organization and the wider community. We are honored to be acknowledged for our leadership, contributions, and innovative initiatives.

Once again, thank you to everyone who has played a part in our DEI journey. This award belongs to all of us, and it motivates us to continue striving for a more inclusive and equitable future.

#DEIAwards2023 #DiversityAndInclusion
#DenverBusinessJournal #EquityMatters #InclusiveCulture

Parker here, co-founder of Inclusive Guide. We're thrilled to share some updates.  From 600+ engaged users to businesses joining us, change is happening! Our Business Dashboard is shaping up, and exciting announcements are around the corner. Your support is our driving force. Let's create an inclusive world together! 💪🌍 #InclusiveGuide #ProgressUpdate #TogetherForChange

Crystal and Parker here! We've been working hard and wanted to let you know that @inclusiveguide has some awesome announcements coming soon. Please keep engaging with us! And please keep sharing our work. Together we can succeeded our mission to make a more inclusive world!

#digitalgreenbook #inclusiveguide #inclusivebusiness #blackowned #womenowned #queerowned @kweenwerk @calebkioh

Summit for Action is back! Please help spread the word. 

Are you ready to be a part of shaping a sustainable future? The Summit for Action is back, and this year's theme is "Building Sustainable Futures: Navigating the Intersection of Environmental Justice, Public Health, and Outdoor Recreation." 🌿✨

📅 Date: Wednesday, October 4 (virtual) Thursday, October 5 (inperson)
🎟️ Register Now: link in bio @kweenwerk

🌟 What to Expect 🌟
The Summit for Action is your opportunity to dive deep into the critical issues that impact our world today. From food insecurity to the climate crisis, health, and water rights, this summit is your gateway to learning, collaborating, and driving positive change. Join hands with experts,  scientists, educators, activists, and community leaders as we explore strategies and solutions for a more sustainable future.

🌎 Summit Highlights 🌎
🌱 Interactive Panel Discussions: Engage in thought-provoking conversations with experts who are at the forefront of sustainability.
🛠️ Practical Discussions: Acquire actionable tools and insights to promote sustainability in your community and organization.
🌐 Networking Opportunities: Connect with like-minded individuals and build a network that fuels change.
🎙️ Keynote Speakers: Be inspired by leaders from diverse fields as they share their perspectives and experiences.

Panels at a Glance 
1️⃣ Cultivating Security in an Insecure World: Learn about the intersection of climate change and food justice and discover solutions to ensure food security for all.
2️⃣ The Interplay of Nature, Environment, and Public Health: Explore how environmental factors impact public health and discover strategies for creating healthier communities.

Don't miss your chance to be a part of this transformative event! Together, we can pave the way for a more sustainable, just, and healthy future. Register now and be the change! 🌎🙌

#SummitForAction #SustainabilityMatters #BeTheChange #BuildingSustainableFutures #TogetherForTomorrow

The United States is evolving with vibrant racial diversity, yet some hearts remain tethered to the past. But a diverse, just and inclusive society includes us all. We are not fighting to replace a system that was built to oppress people of color by oppressing white people, instead we are fighting to build a just society where everyone can not only live but thrive. Let's debunk fears of replacement and unite in crafting an inclusive world where all flourish. This isn't about reversing roles; it's about crafting justice and harmony for everyone. 💙🤝

#InclusiveTomorrow 
#UnityInDiversity
#DiversityandInclusion 
#diversity
#change
#replacementtheory

As a Black woman tech company co-founder, I've personally witnessed the incredible potential and innovation of black women-led businesses. 🚀👩🏾‍💼 It's time to stand together and address the unfair challenges they face in securing funding. Let's turn frustration into fuel for change and actively support their ventures. Join me in investing, advocating, and championing black women's entrepreneurship. 💪🏾🌟 Together, we'll shatter ceilings and pave the way for a more inclusive business landscape.

 #SupportBlackWomenEntrepreneurs #InvestInChange #EmpowerInnovation

At @inclusiveguide we believe that every customer deserves a warm welcome! 🌟 Being aware of service animals and the guidelines that come with them is a crucial step toward creating a more inclusive environment for everyone. We're committed to ensuring that people with disabilities feel comfortable and supported when visiting businesses. Thank you to @jakethes.d for bringing awareness and sharing their story. 

#disabilityawareness
#InclusiveBusiness #ServiceAnimalsWelcome #EmbraceDiversity

Edit: the Spelling for Hmong and Maasai are incorrect in the automatically generated captions. I apologize.

Race and ethnicity may seem similar, but they're like two sides of an intricate tapestry. 

Race: Think of it as the outer layer—based on physical traits like skin color.  But guess what? Science has shown we're more like a mixed palette than neatly defined shades. 

Ethnicity: It's the heart of our cultural fabric! Shared language, traditions, history—these are the threads that weave us into unique groups. 

It's important to recognize that both race and ethnicity are social constructs and can vary in meaning across different societies and contexts. However even though it is a social construct, this legacy of Racial hierarchy has served as a tool for social control and oppression that is very real.

Now that you know a bit more. Let's embrace our diversity with open hearts and curious minds. 

#race
#UnityInDiversity 
#kweenwerk
#RaceAndEthnicityExplained 
#OneWorldManyCultures

Introducing our 2024 Resource Page! Join us on this transformative journey towards greater inclusivity. As we step into the new year, the Inclusive Guide team is thrilled to kickstart 2024 with a powerful message of learning, growth, and social justice. Our mission to create safe and welcoming spaces for everyone who faces discrimination remains at the heart of what we do. 

What to expect from our Resource Page:
📚 A treasure trove of knowledge
🎯 Valuable tools & training modules
🌈 Resources promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion

👉 Why Subscribe to Inclusive Guide Resources?
1️⃣ Weekly Content: Fresh resources added every week!
2️⃣ Inclusive Curriculum:: With new chapters every Monday.
3️⃣ Diverse Topics: Explore various aspects of diversity, equity, and inclusion.

🤝 Support and Access:
For just $20/month, sustain our mission and gain continuous access to updated content. Your support paves the way for a more inclusive future. 🙌

Join us on this journey towards a brighter, more inclusive world! 🌎💫

Subscribe now: Link in Bio

#InclusiveGuide #InclusionMatters #2024Inclusivity #DiversityAndInclusion

If you haven't heard yet In 2024, we are proud to launch our new resource page, a dynamic hub designed to empower individuals and businesses on their journey towards inclusivity. This page will be a treasure trove of knowledge, providing you with valuable tools, training modules, and resources that promote diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Hi. Crystal Egli here, co-founder of an inclusion website, but I sure wasn’t feelin’ inclusive of some things yesterday. 

🕷️Tarantulas, yes. Uh, whatever those weird dancing leaf-like bugs were, absolutely. But COCKROACHES?!? Awww HELL nah. And yet, there’s nothing wrong with them. EXCEPT EVERYTHING AND MY BRAIN WAS ON 🔥FREAKING FIRE🔥. 

That’s how bias can work too, though. 

➡️ Cool Leaf Bug Level Bias: I’ve never seen one before, but it looked like something familiar so I held it no problem! It was super cool! This is called “affinity bias” or “halo bias”.

➡️ Tarantula Level Bias: This one used to be a HARD NO, but I learned some stuff, visited Rosie at the @butterflypavilion enough times and now we’re on good terms! I know how to check preconceived notions around spiders like her and know not to pet their fur. This is not called anything, it’s just “addressing your bias’.”

➡️ Cockroach Level Bias: Never met one and I’m pretty sure all species are NASTY. This is called “horns bias”, as in “Not today, Satan!” I actively avoid spaces they are in and refuse to learn more about them to open my mind. ✨Until yesterday.✨

🤢🤮Yeah I may have puked in my mouth a lot a bit, but I took the first step in reducing my (TOTALLY VALID) bias, I listened to an expert (shoutout to Francisco!) and had support along the way from friends. (See also: antibacterial buckets to dip my hand in afterwards.)

Exposure to new concepts can be 🙀 scary, which is why we created a DEI resources hub online, so y’all can learn in the emotional security of your own home, on your own timeline. (Link in bio for more on that.)

📢Shoutout to @butterflypavilion going above and beyond in making this metaphor happen. Please rate them on Inclusive Guide next time you visit!📢

🕷️🪳Leave a comment with what bug you’ve got the most bias against and if you’d ever try holding one…

Just Joking 6 ways! 😂 Let's tackle some common ways organizations miss the mark on their inclusion efforts.

Tokenism: Instead of merely hiring a few individuals from underrepresented groups and using them as symbols of diversity, organizations should commit to genuine inclusion. Create diverse hiring panels, set measurable diversity goals, and ensure equal opportunities for everyone, irrespective of their background.

Lack of Inclusion: Foster an inclusive workplace culture by promoting open dialogue and creating safe spaces for employees to express themselves. Implement mentorship programs, affinity groups, and regular diversity and inclusion training to ensure all employees feel valued and heard.

Unconscious Bias: Conduct regular diversity and bias training for employees at all levels. Encourage employees to recognize and confront their biases through workshops, seminars, and awareness campaigns. Consider using blind recruitment techniques to minimize bias in hiring.

Insufficient Representation: Ensure diversity at all levels of your organization, including leadership roles. Develop targeted programs to identify and nurture talent from underrepresented groups. Implement succession planning to give diverse employees opportunities for growth and advancement.

Ignoring Employee Feedback: Actively solicit feedback from your employees on diversity and inclusion matters. Create anonymous channels for reporting discrimination and harassment. Take concrete steps to address issues promptly, and communicate the actions being taken to the entire workforce.

Lack of Training: Invest in comprehensive diversity and inclusion training for all employees. Cover topics like cultural competence, respectful communication, and understanding intersectionality. Provide resources for ongoing learning and support, such as diversity-focused reading materials and workshops.

MLK Day Quote Challenge:

1. Look up full versions of Martin Luther King Jr. speeches & letters.
2. Find a quote you don’t hear too often, but it resonates with you.
3. Leave it in the comments.

Bonus Round: If you find a quote another account posted that Martin Luther King Jr. DIDN’T say, post it here and let folks know!

Image Description: Multiple slides with the quote challenge instructions (above) and quotations written on a paper background. Full quotes can be found in the comments, as they are too long for this section.

#mlk #martinlutherkingjr #mlkday #mlkquotes
